Miami_Beach.Crandon Park:
Crandon Park is a 808-acre (3.27 km2) urban park in metropolitan Miami, occupying the northern part of Key Biscayne. It is connected to mainland Miami via the Rickenbacker Causeway.


== History ==

The land Crandon Park occupies was once part of the largest coconut plantation in the United States, operated by William John Matheson and his heirs.
